verses.verse: When a man<WH376> has taken<WH3947> a wife<WH802>, and married<WH1166> her<WH4672>, and it come to pass that she find no favor<WH2580> in his eyes<WH5869>, because he has found<WH4672> some<WH1697> uncleanness<WH6172> in her<WH3789>: then let him write her a bill<WH5612> of divorce<WH3748>, and give<WH5414> it in her hand<WH3027>, and send<WH7971> her out of his house<WH1004>.
And when she is departed out<WH3318> of his house<WH1004>, she may go<WH1980> and be another<WH312> man<WH376>'s wife.

And if the latter<WH314> husband<WH376> hate<WH8130> her<WH3789>, and write her a bill<WH5612> of divorce<WH3748>, and gives<WH5414> it in her hand<WH3027>, and sends<WH7971> her out of his house<WH1004>; or if the latter<WH314> husband<WH376> die<WH4191>, which took<WH3947> her to be his wife<WH802>;

Her former<WH7223> husband<WH1167>, which sent her away<WH7971>, may<WH3201> not take<WH3947> her again<WH7725> to be his wife<WH802>, after<WH310> that she is defiled<WH2930>; for that is abomination<WH8441> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068>: and you shall not cause the land<WH776> to sin<WH2398>, which the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> gives<WH5414> you for an inheritance<WH5159>.

When a man<WH376> has taken<WH3947> a new<WH2319> wife<WH802>, he shall not go out<WH3318> to war<WH6635>, neither shall he be commanded<WH5674> with any business<WH1697>: but he shall be free<WH5355> at home<WH1004> one<WH259> year<WH8141>, and shall cheer up<WH8055> his wife<WH802> which he has taken<WH3947>.
No man shall take<WH2254> the mill<WH7347> or the upper millstone<WH7393> to pledge<WH2254>: for he takes<WH2254> a man<WH5315>'s life to pledge<WH2254>.

If a man<WH376> be found<WH4672> stealing<WH1589> any<WH5315> of his brothers<WH251> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, and makes merchandise<WH6014> of him<WH4376>, or sells him<WH1590>; then that thief shall die<WH4191>; and you shall put<WH1197> evil<WH7451> away<WH1197> from among you<WH7130>.

Take care<WH8104> in the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883>, that you observe<WH8104> diligently<WH3966>, and do<WH6213> according to all that the priests<WH3548> the Levites<WH3881> shall teach<WH3384> you<WH6680>: as I commanded them<WH8104>, so you shall observe to do<WH6213>.
Remember<WH2142> what the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> did<WH6213> unto Miriam<WH4813> by the way<WH1870>, after that you were come forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>.
When you do lend<WH5383> your brother<WH7453> any<WH3972> thing<WH4859>, you shall not go<WH935> into his house<WH1004> to fetch<WH5670> his pledge<WH5667>.
You shall stand<WH5975> abroad<WH2351>, and the man<WH376> to whom you do lend<WH5383> shall bring out<WH3318> the pledge<WH5667> abroad unto you<WH2351>.
And if the man<WH376> be poor<WH6041>, you shall not sleep<WH7901> with his pledge<WH5667>:

In any case<WH7725> you shall deliver<WH7725> him the pledge<WH5667> again<WH7725> when the sun<WH8121> goes down<WH935>, that he may sleep<WH7901> in his own clothes<WH8008>, and bless<WH1288> you<WH6666>: and it shall be righteousness unto you before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>.

You shall not oppress<WH6231> a hired servant<WH7916> that is poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34>, whether he be of your brothers<WH251>, or of your strangers<WH1616> that are in your land<WH776> inside your gates<WH8179>:

At his day<WH3117> you shall give<WH5414> him his hire<WH7939>, neither shall the sun<WH8121> go down<WH935> upon it<WH6041>; for he is poor, and sets<WH5375> his heart<WH5315> upon it<WH7121>: lest he cry against you unto the Lord<WH3068>, and it be sin unto you<WH2399>.

The fathers<WH1> shall not be put to death<WH4191> for the sons<WH1121>, neither shall the sons<WH1121> be put to death<WH4191> for the fathers<WH1>: every man<WH376> shall be put to death<WH4191> for his own sin<WH2399>.
You shall not pervert<WH5186> the judgment<WH4941> of the stranger<WH1616>, nor of the fatherless<WH3490>; nor take<WH2254> a widow<WH490>'s clothes<WH899> to pledge<WH2254>:

But you shall remember<WH2142> that you were a bondman<WH5650> in Egypt<WH4714>, and the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> redeemed<WH6299> you there<WH6680>: therefore I command you to do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>.

When you cut down<WH7114> your harvest<WH7105> in your field<WH7704>, and have forgot<WH7911> a sheaf<WH6016> in the field<WH7704>, you shall not go again<WH7725> to fetch<WH3947> it<WH1616>: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>: that the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> you in all the work<WH4639> of your hands<WH3027>.
When you beat<WH2251> your olive tree<WH2132>, you shall not go over the boughs<WH6286> again<WH310>: it shall be for the stranger<WH1616>, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>.

When you gather<WH1219> the grapes of your vineyard<WH3754>, you shall not glean<WH5953> it afterward<WH310>: it shall be for the stranger<WH1616>, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>.
And you shall remember<WH2142> that you were a bondman<WH5650> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: therefore I command<WH6680> you to do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>.
